page.title: 19TRADE
page.content: The shops in this area are extinct. Large supermarkets outside the area forced the last few small shops to close. The goods did not have the turnover and became stale. The shops could not hold the expensive range and choice of goods which customers expected. Buying in huge quantities by supermarkets undercut the small shopkeepers. The public houses in the area change ownership frequently. One has just changed hands, one is under recent new ownership, and one has its third owner this year. This pattern is statistically significant because the pattern applies to other pubs in adjacent areas.
